summary:
Sega is a Japanese video game company known for its popular game franchises like Sonic the Hedgehog and Yakuza. Founded in 1960 as Nihon Goraku Bussan, it initially made coin-operated games. Sega entered the console market in the 1980s with the SG-1000 and later the Mega Drive/Genesis, competing with Nintendo. After struggles with consoles like Saturn and Dreamcast, Sega stopped making its own hardware in 2001.

The company has studios worldwide, including Sega of America and Sega Europe. It owns several development studios, creating games for various platforms. Sega also has ventures in toys, arcades, and animation, making it a diverse entertainment company.
title: Sega
